CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1940 reads: "Where Uncle Sam Is Training Negro Soldiers in Art Of Anti-Aircraft Defense - Here are some scenes of Fort Bragg, where Negro soldiers are being trained for coastal artillery service for the first time in history. Top, left, is a view of one of the many streets.  The buildings are mess halls (note soldiers at right in line for dinner)... - All photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Single story clapboard buildings, including mess hall with line of Soldiers holding metal plates, Fort Bragg, North Carolina
